meanings.definition: Whomsoever: the objective form of whoever
meanings.sent1: Whomsoever is welcome to join us for dinner.
meanings.sent2: Please inform whomsoever you see about the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Whomsoever forgot their lunch will have to go hungry.
meanings.sent4: The treasure belongs to whomsoever can solve the riddle.
meanings.sent5: Whomsoever arrives first will receive a special prize.

meanings.definition: Whomsoever: used as a pronoun to refer to any person or persons, regardless of gender or number
meanings.sent1: Whomsoever wishes to participate must sign up by Friday.
meanings.sent2: The prize will go to whomsoever wins the competition.
meanings.sent3: Whomsoever can juggle the most oranges will win the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The award is open to whomsoever shows exceptional dedication.
meanings.sent5: Whomsoever arrives late will miss the beginning of the show.
